Holders of travel documents containing a valid Schengen visa, a valid visa of the United States of America, United Kingdom and Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland, or a permission to stay in these countries, may enter and stay, or pass through the territory of Montenegro up to 30 days, and not longer than the expiry of visa, if the period of validity of the visa is less than 30 days.[164]

Morocco previously reported re-introduced visa requirements to Indonesian citizens according to a press release that was issued by Embassy of Republic of Indonesia in Rabat,[166] but there is no confirmation nor statement from Moroccan Ministry of Foreign Affairs to confirm this new policy. According to Moroccan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Indonesian citizens are still eligible to enjoy a 90-day visa waiver to Morocco.[167] The Moroccan Embassy in Jakarta has since clarified that "contrary to some press reports," Morocco does not impose any visa "requirements" on Indonesian citizens to visit Morocco.[168]
A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180-day period in the Schengen Area.
